events.originalText: Nikol Pashinyan began his protest walk, starting in the city of Gyumri, opening the 2018 Armenian revolution.
events.subtitle: Gyumri
events.headline: Nikol Pashinyan starts protest walk in Gyumri, sparking Armenian revolution

events.originalText: The Old National Library Building in Singapore was closed to make way for a tunnel, despite widespread protests.
events.subtitle: Old National Library Building
events.headline: Old National Library Building in Singapore closed for tunnel construction despite protests

events.originalText: American singer-songwriter Selena, known as the "queen of Tejano music", was murdered by the president of her fan club, Yolanda Saldívar, in Corpus Christi, Texas, deeply affecting the Latino community.
events.subtitle: Selena
events.headline: Selena murdered by Yolanda Saldívar in Corpus Christi, Texas, deeply impacting Latino community

events.originalText: USS Missouri (pictured), the last active United States Navy battleship, was decommissioned in Long Beach, California.
events.subtitle: USS Missouri (BB-63)
events.headline: USS Missouri decommissioned in Long Beach, California

events.originalText: After a two-week escape journey from Tibet, the 14th Dalai Lama reached the Tawang Monastery in Arunachal Pradesh in India.
events.subtitle: Dalai Lama's escape from China
events.headline: 14th Dalai Lama reaches Tawang Monastery in Arunachal Pradesh after escape from Tibet

events.originalText: Second World War: Because of a mutiny by Indian soldiers against their British officers, Japanese troops captured Christmas Island without any resistance.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Japanese troops capture Christmas Island due to Indian soldiers' mutiny against British officers

events.originalText: To avoid government censorship, Hollywood movie studios instituted their own set of industry censorship guidelines, popularly known as the Hays Code.
events.subtitle: Cinema of the United States
events.headline: Hollywood movie studios implement Hays Code to avoid government censorship

events.originalText: The Australian Air Force was formed, replacing the short-lived Australian Air Corps and separating it from the Army.
events.subtitle: Royal Australian Air Force
events.headline: Australian Air Force established, separating from Army

events.originalText: Arnold Schoenberg conducted the Vienna Concert Society in a concert of expressionist music that so shocked the audience that they began to riot.
events.subtitle: Arnold Schoenberg
events.headline: Arnold Schoenberg conducts concert of expressionist music causing audience riot in Vienna

events.originalText: Six English towns amalgamated to form a single county borough called Stoke-on-Trent, the first union of its type.
events.subtitle: Federation of Stoke-on-Trent
events.headline: Six English towns merge to form Stoke-on-Trent county borough

events.originalText: A magnitude 7.2 earthquake struck the Black Sea, the most powerful ever recorded in the area.
events.subtitle: Moment magnitude scale
events.headline: Magnitude 7.2 earthquake hits Black Sea, strongest ever recorded in the area

events.originalText: Philippine–American War: Malolos, capital of the First Philippine Republic, was captured by American forces.
events.subtitle: Philippine–American War
events.headline: Malolos, capital of First Philippine Republic, captured by American forces in Philippine–American War

events.originalText: The Eiffel Tower in Paris, France, was inaugurated.
events.subtitle: Eiffel Tower
events.headline: Eiffel Tower inaugurated in Paris, France

events.originalText: U.S. Navy Commodore Matthew C. Perry and the Tokugawa shogunate signed the Convention of Kanagawa, forcing the opening of Japanese ports to American trade.
events.subtitle: United States Navy
events.headline: Convention of Kanagawa signed, opening Japanese ports to American trade

events.originalText: After fighting through the night, the French Navy ship of the line Guillaume Tell surrendered to a British squadron in the Malta Channel.
events.subtitle: Action of 31 March 1800
events.headline: French Navy ship Guillaume Tell surrenders to British squadron in Malta Channel after night battle

events.originalText: Lisbon experienced its second major earthquake in six years, with effects felt as far north as Scotland.
events.subtitle: 1761 Lisbon earthquake
events.headline: Lisbon experiences second major earthquake in six years, felt as far as Scotland

events.originalText: Ferdinand Magellan and members of his crew participated in the first Catholic Mass in the Philippines.
events.subtitle: Ferdinand Magellan
events.headline: Ferdinand Magellan and crew participate in first Catholic Mass in the Philippines

events.originalText: French abbot Bernard of Clairvaux preached a sermon to a crowd at a council in Vézelay, with King Louis VII in attendance, urging the necessity of a Second Crusade.
events.subtitle: Abbot
events.headline: Bernard of Clairvaux preaches necessity of Second Crusade at council in Vézelay with King Louis VII
